sentences.sContent: Nathan was lounging on the grass bank outside the cottage.
sentences.sCn: 内森正懒洋洋地躺在小屋外的草堤上。

sentences.sContent: ...What does the speaker say about the lounge on B deck...

...Passengers are reminded that the lounge on B deck is for the sole use of passengers traveling with cars and that there is another lounge on C deck at the front of the ship for passengers traveling without cars...

synos.tran: [建]休息室；闲逛；躺椅；（英）酒吧间
闲逛；懒洋洋地躺卧；闲混

remMethod.val: loung(看作long， 长的) ＋ e → 放长条(东北方言) → (懒洋洋地)倚或躺

trans.tranOther: a public room in a hotel or other building, that is used by many people as a place to relax
